title: Which 4800IP Champ is Best for Top Lane? Pls Advise
body: I'm looking to possibly hop on board with ranked soon but I'm looking for a top lane champion to main that's within the bracket of 4800IP and down. I was debating on {{champion:39}}  or {{champion:58}}  because they are both really strong picks right now and generally fun to play, but with Irelia nerfs coming around 5.6 I wasn't sure if she'd be a good pick. Any speculation on who I should buy and why? Some tips and tricks for common top lane match-ups would be great too! (:

replies.body:
{{champion:58}} is the exact opposite of his brother. He pretty much always wins lane, but late game he does nothing at all. And in low elo where people don't know how to close-out games quick, being Renekton late game is going to happen far more than you would like.

{{champion:39}} is a strong pick with an excellent late game, but keep in mind she is getting nerfed next patch.

Renekton is an extremely strong mid-game skirmisher now actually. Pantheon holds the "always wins lane, still falls off" niche although his ganks are very nice.

Irelia's nerf is not big at all, but she is still nowhere near as strong as Sion anyway. Basically top lane tiers right now are Sion>Irelia>everyone else relatively balanced.

but riven can be shut down just as easily as any other champs. her counter is CC. so don't expect to be a god in lane early just saying riven gets overhyped too much. you cant play her and win everything lol she does good if played well

If you want to main a top lane champ for ranked, take some things into mind. If they are always on the nerf/buff train, they probably aren't worth maining (new champs mostly). If they are really only considered strong at certain points in the game, then maybe you want somebody relevant throughout the whole game. You also have to know if they are getting banned left and right due to how strong they are. For instance, {{champion:39}} has a pick of 14% but a banrate of 37%. What's the point of maining a champ (or even learning the champ) if you can't play them 1/3 of all games. With all of these things in mind and considering how strong certain champs are right now, I would recommend {{champion:62}}. He has a decent early game to snowball you, but has an amazing mid game so even if you don't do much early you can easily come back with roams and teamfights.

Plus he is fun to use in custom Hide and Seek modes and just overall.
